Reviews.Title: “Be aware of this Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: K2136
Reviews.Content: What can I say: poor small rooms - dirty - poor breakfast - dirty bathrooms Location is nice near to the Sultanhamed but thats all Some days no cleaning in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “One of many small hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: dbcme
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this hotel all over the place on TripAdvisor. Here's the real scoop: -Small rooms - true. But not far off from a typical NYC hotel room. -Rooms also have thin walls, no doubt. But, unless you get stuck with crazy neighbors, you are probably OK. We had a neighbor who occasionally let off a scream (assume she had bad dreams?) but no points docked for the hotel for this. =) -Beds are standard. Nothing to write home about, but sufficient after a long day of walking the city. -Staff - all friendly, varying levels of English speaking. Most very hospitable. Actually it is the owner of the hotel who was the least welcoming during the stay (dare I say grumpy old man). -Breakfast is on the top level, enclosed. Includes cheeses, meats, some pastries and a variety of spreads. Apple Tea and coffee included. Nice view from here. -Location is excellent for sight seeing such as the "blue mosque" and others nearby. Grand Bazaar, subway/tram station, restaurants, all within a hop skip and jump of the hotel. -Tip: A subway/tram ride from IST airport is about $2US, 90 minute ride, including one transfer of trains. Not a bad deal! Your return trip, can purchase a shared bus ride for $7US from the local travel agency across the hotel. Overall the hotel is average. There are many - MANY hotels in this and surrounding areas. Do your homework. Consider this among others. It provides a decent stay for a relatively good price, in a location excellent for sightseeing. One more note: The Musim prayers are 5X a day in IST. The proximity of the Mosque's to the hotel mean at 6am loud...LOUD prayers are broadcast for the entire neighborhood to hear. Even the soundest sleeper should be prepared for a 6am "wake up call". This may not be different from other hotels nearby other mosque's/loud speakers. -

Reviews.Title: “to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: salim o
Reviews.Content: very small room, Small beds, Constarction going on, Service is zero, No one speaks english, breakfast is a desaster

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday at Abella Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: tribonzaii
Reviews.Content: Ä°stanbul and Sultanahmet is one of great place in the world and during my holiday I stayed Abella hotel , room is little small but very clean and very good staff , breakfast yummy :) they alwasy smile and helpfull ..definitely I ll come back to Sultanahmet again ...

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: anda70
Reviews.Content: On arrival (8 pm) told the twin room we had booked was not ready and wouldn't be for a couple of hours as it had water problems...but they had 1 room left which was a triple. As it was late at night in an unfamiliar place we felt we had to take it....then we were made to pay the extra for it in advance. When we eventually got to meet the owner he said he would refund the difference between the cost of the 2 rooms and despite several assurances from him that he is going to do it or has done it over the phone whilst in Turkey and since our return we still have had nothing from him........not a welcome start to a holiday

Reviews.Title: “terrace was unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: baran_bey
Reviews.Content: morning to a beautiful breakfast terrace enjoying the cool wind is an incredible sea views good service friendly staff and comfortable rooms are full 24-hour in a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Well located little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doreen3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great experience at this hotel! The staff, Ibrahim especially, was extremely cordial and helpful, the rooms were small and clean, the breakfast buffet was good (even wonderful, compared to the other ones we've been to in Turkey), and the roof top had an amazing view of the city (you can look over the Marmara when you eat breakfast). A great location from which to explore Istanbul's Sultanahmet sites. If you're interested in spending time on the European side, however, this is a pretty far walk, so you might want to stay at a place closer to the Golden Horn.

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: SGHS
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. Well positioned for Sultanahmet sites - Able to walk around the district in the evenings undisturbed. ( apart from routine Istanbul touting - excessive) Pleasant staff. Prepare for the difference between advertised room price, 'special offers' & front of desk arrival banter ( cash - no cash/credit cards) - for a lethargic receipt and reluctant/non return (assumed as 'tip' before you have the chance to suggest/decide that option) of the change. Definitely 'no frills' - bring own mini toiletries etc. Meals ho hum.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: E_PETRE
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in Abella Hotel in Istanbul! Again! It is the second time, in the same hotel. I think we will come here again the next time. The hotel is in a perfect location for visiting the old city, everything is within walking distance. The hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood near the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia Museum, Topkapi Palaceâ€¦ The service is excellent. The staff is very friendly especially Mr.Ä°BRAHEM. The staff can help with directions, guides, tours. The rooms are not that big, but comfortable. The cleanliness is excellent. Breakfast is at the same level as most hotels we've visited, but the restaurant on the roof is special, with beautiful view at Bosporus and Old Town. I fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT rooftop RESTAURANT; GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: fernandou
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 7 nights in this Hotel .The hotel is in a perfect location for visiting the old city, everything is within walking distance!what a great little hotel!The service is excellent. The staff can help with directions, guides, tours and more.The room was quiet. The breakfast was excellent.especially mr Ä°BRAHEM receptionist and waiter MURAT provided us very good advices about sightseeings, restaurants, cafes - all his recomendations we found the best choice,MURAT was very kind and very smart guy. MURAT was always smiling and gave us excelllent advice.The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Basilica Cistern, Hippodrome, and Spice Bazaar are all within walking distance.I don't think I've ever met a kinder staff.The family run hotel offers 15 rooms .The rooms are not that big, but comfortable. The cleanliness is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant and service”
Reviews.Author: mayday2073
Reviews.Content: I did not have a room reservation at this hotel but had dinner one evening here. The menu selection is wonderful and the food is really good. Had the Turkish meatballs and rice with a salad-great meal! The atmosphere is romantic . Murat and Suphi were very nice, helpful and professional. Would recommend the restaurant which also has a picturesque view of the Blue Mosque. Think we will visit here again the next time I am in Istanbul. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay at the hotel itself but had a fantastic supper there”
Reviews.Author: Mosco-Vite1993
Reviews.Content: It's a kind of a magic - every time I travel abroad I run into a superb places to eat out exactly at the last evening of trip. This time wasn't an exception - we were invited to a cafe that absolutely didn't seem to me prominent in any way. But then I realised it was just a ground floor of a small hotel. The manager led us to a terrace on the roof and - it's not a joke - you can really gasp in amazement because of its picturesque panoramic view. The seaside is always somewhere close to you if you are in Sultanahmet, but the buildings are erected so densely that you can hardly enjoy its view. But from that roof you can observe everything in the city from Galata Tower and Bosphorus to hills on the asian side and ships on the road of Sea of Marmara. Usually in a place with such an advantage they don't carry about something else - but that could not be said about Abella. The waiter is really friendly and a kind of polyglot, the dishes are delicious, too (I can't stand anything with fish so I can warrant at least meat). Even the prices are pretty reasonable, especially for expensive Sultanahmet. The most serious thing I can size upon is several white stains on the roof left by seagulls circling above Istanbul:-) Thank you for my last admirable glance at Istanbul, Abella! And sorry for my small tip - that was the last money I had with me in the trip))

Reviews.Title: “Located right under the nose of the Blue Mosque, nice friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SheikhSahib
Reviews.Content: This budget hotel had reasonable rooms and a good location just 5 minutes to the entrance of Sultan Ahmet Mosque. However, it is a bit of an uphill climb to the mosque and the main road, the trade off is that it is on a quieter road, while being close enough to shops and eateries at night. The staff are very friendly and are happy to arrange tours and things at reasonable prices, though I recomend you try and do things on your own. I can't help but feel that on the same road I could have had a hotel with a better view of the Sultan Ahmet Mosque. the rooms are slightly cramped, but I don't think you can expect any different in this area where space is a pricey commodity. I would personally live slightly away from the area and walk or commute to the Blue Mosque (Istanbul has phenomenal transport). But that's nothing to do with the hotel or its service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: RetiredWanderer
Reviews.Content: We had booked a double room in the Star Holiday Hotel, on the internet. We were given a small room with twin beds and the shower/toilet smelled awful. The staff were not helpful and insisted on being paid the full 50 euro in advance. We moved to the Abella Hotel. What a contrast ! The large clean room and bathroom had a lovely balcony with good views of the Blue Mosque and the bay. The staff were friendly and helpful and the food was good. It only cost 10 euro more than the other hotel. What a relief to find this lovely place from which to enjoy the delights of Istanbul. I fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out everybody!”
Reviews.Author: imihai
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in Abella Hotel in Istanbul! We will NEVER come back for that hotel! The employers are ok, but don't speak very well english (I'm not talking about french or something else!). The manager SUKS! He is such a pain in the ... ! He treated us like some homelleses ! We were lucky 'cause we met him just in the morning when we left! Watch out for the cost of the room!!! On the most sites a double room is 55 euros but is actually 60 euros!!! When we arrived at the reception there was a big sign saying that for all cash payment was a 10% discount. In the morning when we left the sign wasn't there and of course we didn't get the 10% discount! The only thing we liked at this hotel was the terrace and the guy who was working afternoon! My advice is to avoid this hotel if you go in Istanbul! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: hun0
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the neighbourhood of Blue Mosque. Excellent breakfest served in the restaurant on the roof with beautifull view at Bosfor and Old Town. Not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Deception”
Reviews.Author: TVprod
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation on a specialized website. On the description page: - welcome drink >> no such thing - FREE parking >> NO such thing (8 Turkish lira/day). Tried to explain the discrepancy to the manager. He first promised to solve the problem and at the end of our stay he behaved really rude and blamed the government (!!!). So we had to pay for the parking. The breakfast is frugal: 2 types of cheese, salami, olives, butter, honey, cucumber, tomatoes, tea, boiled eggs and instant coffee. No water, no juice. A little bottle of water (0, 5 l ) costs 2 lira, that is 4 times more expensive than at the stores in the area. As the hotel was not fully booked, they re-used the "leftovers"... Wireless connection is only working in the lobby, not all over the property, as described on their official description on the reservation website. On the positive side, the rooms were clean, yet really small, and with a nice view. The main good thing about this hotel is its location, very near to the Blue Mosque and the other tourist attractions, that can be reached by foot in a matter of minutes. My conclusion: if you only need a decent room to spend the night after visiting the city, it's all right. A bit overpriced...
